feed.title: chris’s website
feed.subtitle: I am currently a PhD Student at Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, China. I have been doing research on large-scale image retrieval algorithms and applications.My Ph.D research work covers a wide range of computer vision, with a primary focus on extbf{large-scale efficient image retrieval, person re-identification, vehicle re-identification, transfer learning, contrastive learning }. Currently, I am interesting in deep learning (CNN, GAN, Vision Transformer, etc.) and their applications to computer vision (image processing, video analysis, etc.). My recent research focus is the application of vision transfer (ViT) in deep hashing for image retrieval and in cross-modal retrieval.

entry.title: Yongbiao delivered two oral presentations at ICMR!

link.title: Yongbiao delivered two oral presentations at ICMR!

entry.content: Yongbiao delivered two oral presentations at ACM International Conference on Multimedia Retrieval (ICMR 2022) remotely owing to the covid restrictions in China. The conference is amazing!
entry.summary: Yongbiao delivered two oral presentations at ACM International Conference on Multimedia Retrieval (ICMR 2022) remotely owing to the covid restrictions in China. The conference is amazing!

entry.title: One paper accepted by Frontiers in Neuroscience

link.title: One paper accepted by Frontiers in Neuroscience

entry.content: Our paper “Sstdp: Supervised spike timing dependent plasticity for efficient spiking neural network training “ has been accepted by Frontiers in Neuroscience !
entry.summary: Our paper “Sstdp: Supervised spike timing dependent plasticity for efficient spiking neural network training “ has been accepted by Frontiers in Neuroscience !

entry.title: Two papers are accepted to ICMR

link.title: Two papers are accepted to ICMR

entry.content:
We have Two papers accepted to the ACM International Conference on Multimedia Retrieval (ICMR 2022) which will be held at Newark, USA. The names of these papers are:

  1. Transhash: Transformer-based hamming hashing for efficient image retrieval.
  2. Supervised Contrastive Vehicle Quantization for Efficient Vehicle Retrieval.
entry.summary: We have Two papers accepted to the ACM International Conference on Multimedia Retrieval (ICMR 2022) which will be held at Newark, USA. The names of these papers are: Transhash: Transformer-based hamming hashing for efficient image retrieval. Supervised Contrastive Vehicle Quantization for Efficient Vehicle Retrieval.

entry.title: Three papers are accepted to DAC

link.title: Three papers are accepted to DAC

entry.content:
We have three papers accepted to the top-tier conference (Design Automation Conference (DAC)). The names of these papers are:

  1. PIM-DH: ReRAM-based Processing-in-Memory Architecture for Deep Hashing Acceleration.
  2. SATO: Spiking Neural Network Acceleration via Temporal-Oriented Dataflow and Architecture.
  3. EBSP: Evolving Bit Sparsity Patterns for Hardware-Friendly Inference of Quantized Deep Neural Networks.
entry.summary: We have three papers accepted to the top-tier conference (Design Automation Conference (DAC)). The names of these papers are: PIM-DH: ReRAM-based Processing-in-Memory Architecture for Deep Hashing Acceleration. SATO: Spiking Neural Network Acceleration via Temporal-Oriented Dataflow and Architecture. EBSP: Evolving Bit Sparsity Patterns for Hardware-Friendly Inference of Quantized Deep Neural Networks.

entry.content: Congrats to Fangxin! Fangxin will deliver an oral presentation at AAAI 2022!
entry.summary: Congrats to Fangxin! Fangxin will deliver an oral presentation at AAAI 2022!

entry.title: One paper accepted by AAAI!
entry.content: Our paper “Spikeconverter: An efficient conversion framework zipping the gap between artificial neural networks and spiking neural networks” has been accepted by AAAI 2022 !
entry.summary: Our paper “Spikeconverter: An efficient conversion framework zipping the gap between artificial neural networks and spiking neural networks” has been accepted by AAAI 2022 !

entry.title: One paper accepted by ICCAD!
entry.content: Our paper “Bit-Transformer: Transforming Bit-level Sparsity into Higher Preformance in ReRAM-based Accelerator” has been accepted by ICCAD’21 !
entry.summary: Our paper “Bit-Transformer: Transforming Bit-level Sparsity into Higher Preformance in ReRAM-based Accelerator” has been accepted by ICCAD’21 !

entry.title: One paper accepted by ICME!
entry.content: Our paper “Non-Local Attention Learning for Medical Image Classification” gets accepted by ICME 2021!
entry.summary: Our paper “Non-Local Attention Learning for Medical Image Classification” gets accepted by ICME 2021!

entry.title: Yongbiao delivered an oral presentation remotely at ICMR!

link.title: Yongbiao delivered an oral presentation remotely at ICMR!

entry.content: Yongbiao attended the ICMR 2020 conference online owing to the widespread covid pandemic. He delivered an oral presentation for 20 minutes remotely.
entry.summary: Yongbiao attended the ICMR 2020 conference online owing to the widespread covid pandemic. He delivered an oral presentation for 20 minutes remotely.

entry.title: One paper accepted by ICMR!
entry.content: Our paper “MAENet: Boosting Feature Representation for Cross-Modal Person Re-Identification with Pairwise Supervision” gets accepted by ICMR 2020!
entry.summary: Our paper “MAENet: Boosting Feature Representation for Cross-Modal Person Re-Identification with Pairwise Supervision” gets accepted by ICMR 2020!
